definition.conceptual: The Bohr radius is the most probable distance between the nucleus and the electron in a hydrogen atom in its ground state. It serves as the natural unit of length in atomic physics and defines the scale of atomic dimensions.

mathematical.formula: a₀ = ℏ/(m_e c α) = ℏ²/(m_e e²/(4πε₀)) = 4πε₀ℏ²/(m_e e²)

alternative_forms.description: In terms of electron Compton wavelength
In terms of reduced Compton wavelength

derivation_steps: Start with a₀ = ℏ/(m_e c α)

ratio_to_planck_length.interpretation: The Bohr radius is about 10²⁴ times larger than the Planck length, representing the vast separation between atomic and Planck scales

planck_scale_relationship.hierarchy_explanation: The enormous ratio a₀/ℓ_P reflects the hierarchy problem: why is gravity so weak compared to electromagnetism? The answer lies in the small dimensionless ratio m_e/m_P ≈ 4.2×10⁻²³

quantum_mechanics: Defines the characteristic size of hydrogen atom
Sets the scale for all atomic physics
Appears in wave functions of hydrogen-like atoms
Determines atomic energy levels via E_n = -m_e c² α²/(2n²)
atomic_physics: Natural unit of length in atomic calculations
Atomic radii typically range from 0.5a₀ to 5a₀
Covalent and ionic radii scaled to a₀
Molecular bond lengths are multiples of a₀

connections_to_other_scales.interpretation: Bohr radius is much larger than Compton wavelength due to weak electromagnetic coupling
Classical radius is much smaller, at the frontier of QED validity

applications.description: All atomic transition calculations use a₀ as natural length scale
Molecular orbital calculations in atomic units (a₀ = 1)
Lattice constants, screening lengths, and effective Bohr radii in semiconductors
Effective Bohr radius determines exciton size: a₀* = ε(m_e/m*)a₀

dimensional_analysis.characteristic_role: Sets atomic length scale from quantum (ℏ) and electromagnetic (e, ε₀) constants

primary_sources.author: Niels Bohr
primary_sources.title: On the Constitution of Atoms and Molecules
CODATA Recommended Values of the Fundamental Physical Constants: 2018

common_misconceptions.misconception: The Bohr radius is the actual electron orbit radius
common_misconceptions.correction: In quantum mechanics, there is no definite orbit. a₀ is the most probable distance from the nucleus in the hydrogen ground state.
The Bohr radius scales for hydrogen-like ions as a₀/Z, and effective Bohr radii appear in semiconductors and quantum dots.

teaching_tips: Emphasize a₀ as the 'natural ruler' for atomic physics
Show how a₀ emerges from balancing electrostatic attraction and quantum kinetic energy
Connect to the uncertainty principle: confining electron to smaller region increases kinetic energy

difficulty_progression.introductory: a₀ ≈ 0.53 Å is the size of a hydrogen atom
difficulty_progression.intermediate: a₀ = ℏ²/(m_e e²) from minimizing total energy
difficulty_progression.advanced: a₀ = (α m_e c)⁻¹ℏ showing role of fine-structure constant
